response:
Alright, let's break this down. Alice is offering me $66.67. Due to inflation, the value of the money is 36% less than in the first round. So, $66.67 is worth $66.67 * (1 - 0.36) = $42.67 (in original value).

If I reject, the value of the money will drop again. My money is worth 20% less and hers is 5% less.

If I reject, in the next round the money I gain will be worth 48.8% less than in the first round. (36% + 20% of the remaining 64%)

It's tempting to reject and make another offer, but the inflation is hurting me more than Alice. Given that $42.67 is a decent amount (in original value), it might be wise to accept. While not ideal, avoiding further loss seems prudent.

